meanings.definition: Tossy (adjective): characterized by being easily thrown or tossed
meanings.sent1: The beach ball felt very tossy in my hands.
meanings.sent2: The paper airplane was light and tossy as it glided through the air.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy pillow looked so tossy, I couldn't resist throwing it around.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as tossy as a feather floating in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The autumn leaves danced in the air, creating a tossy spectacle.

meanings.definition: Tossy (verb): to throw or flip something lightly and casually
meanings.sent1: She would tossy the ball to her dog in the park.
meanings.sent2: He liked to tossy coins into the fountain for good luck.
meanings.sent3: The chef would tossy the pizza dough high in the air before catching it.
meanings.sent4: The waves would tossy the boat gently on the water.
meanings.sent5: The children would tossy pebbles into the pond, creating ripples.
